title: A001: Implement project scaffold and database layer
description: backend/ with pyproject.toml, app/main.py (FastAPI + CORS), app/config.py (pydantic-settings, all env vars), app/database.py (async engine, session, get_db() dependency).

stories.title: Developer can set up and run the backend project locally
stories.want: a working backend/ directory with pyproject.toml, dependency management via uv, and a runnable FastAPI application
stories.so_that: I can start building features on a properly configured project foundation
criteria: Running `uv sync` in backend/ installs all dependencies without errors
Running `uv run fastapi dev app/main.py --port 8000` starts the server and responds on http://localhost:8000
The project uses Python 3.13 as specified in pyproject.toml
All production dependencies (fastapi, sqlalchemy[asyncpg], pydantic-settings, uvicorn, structlog, bcrypt, pyjwt, httpx) are declared
All dev dependencies (pytest, pytest-asyncio, httpx, ruff, mypy) are declared

stories.title: Developer can configure the application via environment variables
stories.want: a pydantic-settings based config module that loads all environment variables with sensible defaults
stories.so_that: the application can be configured differently for development, testing, and production without code changes
criteria: All env vars from README are present: DATABASE_URL, JWT_SECRET, JWT_ACCESS_EXPIRE_MINUTES, JWT_REFRESH_EXPIRE_DAYS, CORS_ORIGINS, WS_INITIAL_HOURS, GITHUB_TOKEN, LOG_LEVEL
DATABASE_URL defaults to postgresql+asyncpg://user:pass@localhost:5432/statusboard
JWT_SECRET has no default and is required
All other env vars have the defaults specified in the README
Settings are accessible via a cached get_settings() function
Invalid or missing required config causes a clear validation error at startup

stories.title: Developer can connect to PostgreSQL via async SQLAlchemy
stories.want: an async SQLAlchemy engine and session factory configured from DATABASE_URL
stories.so_that: all future ORM models and queries use async I/O for non-blocking database access
criteria: async engine is created using create_async_engine with the DATABASE_URL from config
async_sessionmaker is configured with expire_on_commit=False
get_db() is an async generator yielding AsyncSession for use as a FastAPI dependency
Sessions are properly closed after use (even on exception)
Engine pool settings are configurable or use reasonable defaults

stories.title: FastAPI app starts with CORS configured for the frontend origin
stories.want: the FastAPI application to include CORS middleware allowing the frontend origin
stories.so_that: the Next.js frontend at localhost:3000 can make cross-origin requests to the backend
criteria: CORS middleware allows origins from the CORS_ORIGINS config value
CORS_ORIGINS supports multiple comma-separated origins
Credentials, all headers, and all methods are allowed
A request from an allowed origin receives proper CORS headers
A request from a disallowed origin does not receive CORS headers

tasks.title: Create backend/ directory structure with pyproject.toml and all dependencies (REQ-001, REQ-009)
tasks.description: Create backend/ directory. Create pyproject.toml with: project name 'team-statusboard', requires-python='>=3.13', production deps (fastapi, uvicorn[standard], sqlalchemy[asyncpg], asyncpg, pydantic-settings, structlog, bcrypt, pyjwt, httpx, alembic), dev deps (pytest, pytest-asyncio, httpx, ruff, mypy). Add [tool.ruff] with target-version='py313', line-length=88. Add [tool.mypy] with strict=true. Add [tool.pytest.ini_options] with asyncio_mode='auto'. Create all directory scaffolding per README: app/__init__.py, app/models/__init__.py, app/schemas/__init__.py, app/api/__init__.py, app/api/routes/__init__.py, app/services/__init__.py, tests/__init__.py, tests/unit/__init__.py, tests/integration/__init__.py. Run `uv sync` to verify.

tasks.title: Implement app/config.py with Settings class and all environment variables (REQ-002)
tasks.description: Create app/config.py. Define a Settings class extending pydantic_settings.BaseSettings with: database_url (str, default 'postgresql+asyncpg://user:pass@localhost:5432/statusboard'), jwt_secret (str, no default — required), jwt_access_expire_minutes (int, default 30), jwt_refresh_expire_days (int, default 7), cors_origins (list[str], default ['http://localhost:3000'] — use a validator to split comma-separated string), ws_initial_hours (int, default 1), github_token (str | None, default None), log_level (str, default 'INFO'). Add model_config with env_file='.env'. Add a @lru_cache get_settings() function. Write tests in tests/unit/test_config.py: test defaults, test JWT_SECRET required, test env overrides, test CORS parsing.

tasks.title: Implement app/database.py with async engine, session factory, and get_db() dependency (REQ-003)
tasks.description: Create app/database.py. Import create_async_engine, async_sessionmaker from sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio. Import DeclarativeBase for ORM base class. Create engine using settings.database_url. Create async_session_factory = async_sessionmaker(engine, expire_on_commit=False). Define a Base class (class Base(DeclarativeBase): pass) for future models. Define async def get_db() -> AsyncGenerator[AsyncSession, None] that yields a session and ensures close. Write tests in tests/unit/test_database.py: test get_db yields AsyncSession, test session is closed after generator exits.

tasks.title: Implement app/main.py with FastAPI app, CORS middleware, and health check endpoint (REQ-004, REQ-005, REQ-006)
tasks.description: Create app/main.py. Instantiate FastAPI(title='Team Statusboard', version='0.1.0'). Add CORSMiddleware with allow_origins from settings.cors_origins, allow_credentials=True, allow_methods=['*'], allow_headers=['*']. Create an api_router with prefix '/api/v1'. Add GET /health endpoint returning {'status': 'ok'}. Include the router in the app. Verify /docs and /redoc are enabled (FastAPI default). Write tests in tests/unit/test_main.py: test health returns 200, test CORS allows configured origin, test CORS blocks other origins, test /docs accessible, test /redoc accessible.

tasks.title: Create tests/conftest.py with shared test fixtures (REQ-008)
tasks.description: Create tests/conftest.py. Define a test_settings fixture that creates Settings with jwt_secret='test-secret-key' and overrides database_url to use sqlite+aiosqlite for unit tests (no real DB needed for scaffold). Define an async client fixture that creates httpx.AsyncClient with ASGITransport(app=app) for testing FastAPI endpoints. Use app.dependency_overrides to inject test settings where needed. Ensure all existing tests pass with `uv run pytest -v`.

tasks.title: Write Reference documentation for backend scaffold (config, database, app entry point)
tasks.description: Run `uv run ruff check app/ tests/` and fix any lint errors. Run `uv run mypy app/` and fix any type errors. Ensure both commands return zero exit codes. This task verifies all scaffold code meets quality standards before completion.

implementation_notes:
This is the very first feature — greenfield. No existing code to follow.

Architectural decisions:
- Use pydantic-settings BaseSettings for config to get automatic env var loading and .env file support
- Use @lru_cache on get_settings() so the Settings instance is created once and reused
- CORS_ORIGINS stored as list[str] with a @field_validator to handle comma-separated string from env
- Database engine created at module level using settings; get_db() is an async generator dependency
- DeclarativeBase defined in database.py so all future models import Base from one place
- Health check at /api/v1/health (versioned API prefix from the start)
- All package directories (models/, schemas/, api/, api/routes/, services/) created with empty __init__.py to enable imports in subsequent features
- Test infrastructure uses httpx.AsyncClient with ASGITransport for async endpoint testing
- pytest-asyncio configured with asyncio_mode='auto' so tests don't need explicit markers

Key files:
- backend/pyproject.toml — project metadata, dependencies, tool config
- backend/app/config.py — Settings class, get_settings()
- backend/app/database.py — engine, async_session_factory, Base, get_db()
- backend/app/main.py — FastAPI app, CORS, health check
- backend/tests/conftest.py — shared fixtures
- backend/tests/unit/test_config.py — config tests
- backend/tests/unit/test_database.py — database module tests
- backend/tests/unit/test_main.py — app endpoint/CORS tests

Risks:
- asyncpg requires a running PostgreSQL for real connections; unit tests should mock or use SQLite with aiosqlite
- pydantic-settings reads from process env, so tests must carefully control env vars (use monkeypatch or explicit construction)
- mypy strict mode may require explicit type annotations on all functions including fixtures
